name: Beals Point Campground
description: Family-friendly campground at Folsom Lake with 69 campsites accommodating trailers and RVs up to 31 feet. Features beach access, snack bar, and water recreation.
amenities: hot showers,beach access,snack bar,kayak rentals,hiking trails

name: Fallen Leaf Lake Campground
description: Large forest campground with 206 sites including six yurts. Wooded sites near Fallen Leaf Lake with hot showers and stunning mountain views.
amenities: hot showers,general store,food storage boxes,paved parking
reservation_info: Recreation.gov or 877-444-6777. Open mid-May to mid-October

name: Nevada Beach Campground
description: Lakeside campground with beach access on Lake Tahoe's southeast shore. No hookups but great location for water activities and lake views.

name: Emerald Bay State Park - Eagle Point
description: Scenic campground with 100+ sites near iconic Emerald Bay. Mix of tent and RV sites with stunning lake views and access to hiking trails.

name: Camp Richardson Resort
description: Full-service resort with 300+ tent and RV sites plus cabins. Features lakefront restaurant, marina, general store, and mountain sports center.

name: Stumpy Meadows Campground
description: Peaceful forest campground on Stumpy Meadows Reservoir with 40 sites. Great for fishing and swimming with 5 mph speed limit on lake.
reservation_info: Recreation.gov or 877-444-6777. Open late May to late September

name: Peninsula Campground - Folsom Lake
description: Secluded oak woodland camping with 104 sites at Folsom Lake. Peaceful retreat with access to water sports and hiking trails.

name: D.L. Bliss State Park
description: Premium lakeside campground with 147 sites and beach access. Features Rubicon Trail access and stunning Lake Tahoe views. Currently closed for 2025.
reservation_info: ReserveCalifornia.com. Closed for 2025 season - waterline replacement

name: Emerald Bay Boat-In Camp
description: Primitive boat-in only campground with 20 sites. Each site includes personal buoy and private dock access. Unique backcountry experience.
facilities: vault toilets,drinking water,picnic tables,fire pits,bear boxes

name: Lake Tahoe KOA
description: Private campground with friendly staff and well-enforced quiet hours. Beautifully shaded sites under tall trees near South Lake Tahoe.
reservation_info: Call or visit KOA.com for reservations

name: Zephyr Cove Campground
description: Full-service campground with marina, horse stables, and restaurant. Sandy beach access and turquoise waters. RV sites with full hookups available.

name: Wrights Lake Campground
description: High elevation alpine campground in Crystal Basin with 72 sites. Access to multiple alpine lakes and granite peaks. Popular with backpackers.
reservation_info: Recreation.gov. Usually opens July, weather dependent

name: China Flat Campground
description: Shaded campground along Silver Fork American River with 18 sites. Quiet forest setting with river access for fishing and gold panning.

name: Finnon Lake Recreation Area
description: Small county park with camping and fishing on 42-acre lake. Family-friendly with playground and easy lake access. Day use and camping available.

name: Tahoe Valley Campground
description: Pet-friendly private campground with dog park and full RV hookups. Close to South Lake Tahoe attractions and casinos.
